As Tucson tries to get up onto his feet, he suddenly finds that his body ha=
s no strength to keep him up on his legs.  He falls onto his knees and then=
 catches himself with his hands.

" Hmm..  I- think that's where I may need=
 to go.  That - last action I took, may have taken a toll on my battery sys=
tem."

f the

im

e

ross his features. "How much damage do

y, who had been standing in the shadows up to this time, looking
> >> more =
like a weapon of war than doctor looked at Perceptor, his single
> >> optic=

thoughtfully, "Perhaps she sould be brought here so that her
> >> status ca=
n be ascertained?"
> >>
> >> Meanwhile Torca, who had been observing nodded=

> >> horned head almost scraping the cieling as he ad=
vised them to wait
> >> before they had thier briefing. "You are correct Tu=
scon." he said, his
> >> deep voice filling the room. "I shall wait for a s=
hort time. However
> >> the council's message will not wait long."
> >>
> >=

> >>=
 the medical chamber still looking through the glass. He had left
> >> Silv=
erbolt in charge of the Fuzors while he had been away, now it was
> >> time=
 to catch up.
> >>
> >> He stepped out of the and into the observation room=
, "Silverbolt."

way followed by
> >> Bantor. "It has been some time."
